these guys american black metal
represent now these guys other than that
with 2007's to hunters and the album
that came before that diadem of 12 stars
these guys were creating this this
really vast an open style of black metal
it sounded like a black metal ocean
that's how massive these records sound
atmospheric black metal isn't new at all
it's not a new concept but these guys
brought it to a different stylistic
level to the point where it was almost
like shoegaze music and these guys also
kind of brought American black metal to
a new level of popularity to it just
kind of put black metal on the table as
being a worthy discussion for people who
weren't just black metal fans now is
American atmospheric black metal was
getting bigger wolves in the throne room
went in a kind of different direction
with their next LP black cascade there
were still some effects on this album
but wolves in the throne room stripped a
lot of the reverb away and just put all
the guitars drums and vocals in in plain
sight it was a very kind of naked
direction for the band now this new LP
celestial lineage this feels like a much
more kind of logical follow-up to two
hunters everything that made 12 stars
and two hunters unique records is back
and kind of taken up to a higher level I
feel like the female vocals on this
album are spotlighted more their their
lavish sound effects and field
recordings and and
chimes pop in a little bit there's a
pretty noticeable synthesizers on here a
spot where I think I'm hearing harp and
some male choruses to the atmosphere
from wolves in the throne rooms earlier
work is back to it's not as high as it
was on two hunters and twelve stars and
I'm liking that because it's kind of
made this LP feel more heavy than it is
hazy but I have a pretty big gripe about
this LP sometimes something that's
really holding me back and keeping me
from loving it I feel like these guys
haven't really pushed themselves past
their previous efforts to really kind of
make this feel like a new album this to
me kind of feels like an old album but
with some slightly new additions the
freshest out of all the tracks on here
to me feels like the first song which
starts off with these really kind of
empowering female vocals has all these
new righteous guitar leads that these
guys haven't really explored yet but you
know as beautiful as other tracks are
like Woodland Cathedral where you've got
these female vocals singing over a
really kind of primal and sparse beat
with these soft distorted guitars in the
background it's not really like new
territory for the band another track
like subterranean initiation just comes
on really hard but it feels like a
little bit of deja vu for me wolves in
the throne room throw some new sounds
and ideas into a couple interludes on
this album but outside of that I feel
like they're pretty much aiming at the
same target same exact target that they
aim for on previous albums it's a target
that I think they've already hit the
bullseye on it makes me think of another
American black metal band with third and
fourth albums Agalloch their third LP
ashes against the grain is way different
than marrow of the Spirit not only did
Agalloch change what production and what
instrumentation they surround their
songs with but they changed how they
write their songs to wolves in the
throne room on the other hand in my
opinion are just kind of writing songs
the same way that they have been it's
like the same buildups
same concepts the same anthemic asked
melodies thrown in the same spots at the
end of these same ten-minute tracks
there are similar chord progressions too
I feel like the only difference this
time around is that it's done with with
more volume and more layers and you know
what that has its merits too
consistency is important and if you're
into wolves and the therm room sound
then there aren't really going to be any
potholes on this release for you and the
thing is I like this - when I was
listening to it it's not like I was
scrambling to turn it off but then again
if I was given the choice to listen to
this or twelve stars or two hunters I'm
going to opt for one of those two albums
before this and those two albums already
sit in my collection I'm feeling a light
decent six on this thing thought it was
decent like I said not really any
potholes on this but it's not offering
anything refreshing to me that makes me
